main event: An unidentified aerial object was sighted by three persons in Bliss, Idaho, and described as 6 to 10 feet in diameter on 14 December 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as burning a bright orange color., The witnesses approached the object within a few yards before it suddenly climbed to about 1000 feet., The witnesses attempted to follow the object in their vehicle but lost sight of it after it flew southwest., The object was reported to have no apparent means of propulsion other than spinning., Weather reports indicated a possible lack of authenticity in the sighting incident.
witness description: three men driving in a car, Deputy Sheriff Hipper reported the sighting
